title: So, The Taric Update is sooooon, what are you hoping for?
body:
I'm personally terrified he might lose his identity. I know I won't be able to like every aspect of his changes simply because I like him as he is, but at the same time dislike how simple he is (and that they nerfed his brief top-lane superiority ^^). I also have the basic fear that he might become too OP and using him will be the same as using Lee Sin (i.e. you use him because he's good, not because you like his style/theme).

Also, I have been burned before (Poor poor Karma, where are your FANS gurl? Where is your Ally/Enemy tether gurl? Where is your mid-year mage rework gurrrl? :P)

But I am super excited for the change anyway, because it also means he might gain new roles (return of top/jungle options?) and some of his abilities might become something your team actually NOTICES the effect of (Did Taric ult? What's Taric's Ult? It's that disco ball thing. Ohhhhhh *dance*)

So, what are you hoping they keep? What are you hoping is changed? What fills you with a terror so deep you cannot sleep at night (possibly not Taric related? Need to talk? A shoulder? Someone to Imbue you?)

replies.body:
Change Radiance, it is easily the worst ultimate in the game.

That is all I ask.
K.
Oh my god, Senpai noticed me.

I know its not the strongest, but as someone who's experimented with him for so many games, I've found that:
- its useful for solo pushing on a turret
- its a game changer for team fights
- helps pick off that enemy with low health

but if it can get changed into something better, I'm not going to complain. Just wanted people to know that his R wasn't unusable.
RiotRepertoir is secretly {{champion:33}}

*cough*{{champion:143}}*cough*

Radiance is actually pretty strong when used optimally.
It's just a stat-check ult though, so I don't necessarily disagree with removing it.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XveYVO93,comment-id=00040003,timestamp=2016-02-09T05:14:02.457+0000)
>
> *cough*{{champion:143}}*cough*

{{champion:143}} ult is amazing, what are you talking about?

Her passive is bad but her ultimate is great.

> Radiance is actually pretty strong when used optimally.

No it is not. It is absolute garbage... the statistics are very low and spread out rather than concentrated.... and even if you hit multiple targets, rarely will both the (low AD/AP) benefit  ever be used given that the majority of characters only use one.... even at max level it is lower than a Janna E.

Brain fart. I was thinking of the Zyra passive when I posted that. (>_>)

Taric gets 70 flat AD & AP from it. For comparison, Vayne gets 70 flat AD from her ult.
Janna Gives 1 target 50 (+10% AP) AD. Taric gives all nearby champions 35 AD & AP.

So in terms of raw stats, Taric ult beats Janna ult by default (70 VS 50). If we ignore self cast, taric beats her with 2 nearby champions (50 VS 70). If we look at a 5v5 team fight, Taric is giving out ***140*** AD *and* AP (in addition to his self buff).
---------------
But looking at it in terms of gold value (referencing wiki):
AD is worth 35 gold, AP is 21.75, health (for shield) is 2.67.

Taric's has a max value of **11 917.5**
( [210x35=7350]+[210x21.75=4567.5] )

Janna has a value of **2390.8**
( [50x35=1750]+[240x2.67=640.8] )

Just for laughs, lets assume Janna has 300 AP.
AD: 50+30= 80
Shield: [300x0.7=210]+240= 450
This gives Janna a value of **4001.5**
( [80x35=2800]+[450x2.67=1201.5] )

---------------

Just another note: Taric's ult grants the bonus for 10 seconds to allies in range. Janna's shield grants bonus AD for 5 seconds or until the shield breaks. Assuming 1 target in for the full duration with 1.0 AS: Taric will give a bonus of 350 damage VS janna at 250 damage. If we give Janna 300 AP again, she gives a bonus of 400 damage.

-------------

Janna's only advantage is her shield's lower CD, but otherwise Taric's ult beats her shield in almost every way.

Taric's ult *looks* weak because it suffers the aura problem: it has to be balanced around the best case scenario. But it's still incredibly powerful.
At the end of the day though, his ult is purely boring and invisible stats. That why I (personally) wouldn't be remiss if they replaced it. Though I also rarely play Taric, so my opinion isn't worth much.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XveYVO93,comment-id=0004000300000000,timestamp=2016-02-09T19:11:19.339+0000)
>
> Brain fart. I was thinking of the Zyra passive when I posted that. (>_>)

Yes, it made absolutely no sense the way you said it but I suspected what you actually meant.

>Taric gets 70 flat AD & AP from it. For comparison, Vayne gets 70 flat AD from her ult.

Correct, except Taric's scalings are atrocious and his autoattack damage modification is meaningless. On average Taric personally, does significantly less damage than say... Morgana, or even Leona.

> Janna Gives 1 target 50 (+10% AP) AD. Taric gives all nearby champions 35 AD & AP.

Correct, except Janna's E performs at maximum at level 9, Taric's ult only performs optimally at level 16. 
Janna's E scales with AP, Taric's ult does not.
Janna's E has 10 second cooldown with zero CDR which, even in optimal scenarios (Taric spamming to trigger passive) will still be quicker than Radiance (Obviously)
Janna's Shield once applied will remain as long as it holds, Taric needs to be near his targets.

> So in terms of raw stats, Taric ult beats Janna ult by default (70 VS 50). 

No. Taric himself gets 70 AD , the others get half.
Furthermore Janna's ult is Monsoon , not Eye of the Storm.

> Taric needs at least two nearby allied champions and again, that only works 

Yes, at maximum level and only just barely.

> But looking at it in terms of gold value (referencing wiki):
> AD is worth 35 gold, AP is 21.75, health (for shield) is 2.67.

Meaningless, the benefit is spread across many champions and thus, is significantly less valuable than a concentrated benefit (Janna).

> Taric's has a max value of **11 917.5**

Complete unadulterated BS.
That value is assuming every single character is in range and makes use of both AP/AD .

> Janna has a value of **2390.8**

Except Janna's has greater uptime, greater concentrated benefit and arguably greater range.

> Just another note: Taric's ult grants the bonus for 10 seconds to allies in range. Janna's shield grants bonus AD for 5 seconds or until the shield breaks.

Correct, except Taric's ult has limited range and significantly lower uptime... furthermore , it never overtakes Janna's direct AD benefit. And keep in mind we're comparing an ultimate to a NON ultimate spell... given the variables, the non ultimate spell is still coming out ahead.

> Janna's only advantage is her shield's lower CD, but otherwise Taric's ult beats her shield in almost every way.

Yes, lower CD.
And greater potential range.
And greater AD benefit.

If we ignore all of these, then yes, Radiance (the ultimate) is slightly better than Eye of the Storm (non ultimate).

I do enjoy watching you desperately try to stack-the-deck in favor of Radiance... it's amusing.

> Taric's ult looks weak 

"Looks" have nothing to do with it, it is weak, it is pure garbage and needs to  be buffed, a lot.

Originally , Taric's Radiance was a heal-over-time with aura stat benefit... it was nerfed to just be stat benefit and a miserable nuke, since then it has been the worst ultimate in the game.

Hm..... I really need to pay more attention to whom I am replying too.
Oh well, too late now.

--------------------------

>Correct, except Taric's scalings are atrocious and his autoattack damage modification is meaningless. On average Taric personally, does significantly less damage than say... Morgana, or even Leona.

You're comparing overall contribution to individual spikes. Even more, you're comparing kill lane supports to a buff support.
Yes, morgana and Leona do more damage. That's kinda the point. They both have a large chunk of their power budget tied up in that damage, where Taric places more stock in his utility. Taric's ult gives him a specific window of power that the other two don't share; so it makes sense that his overall damage out-put would be less.

The reason I compared Vayne is because the forums like to point out how she gets a huge AD buff from her ult. While Taric gives himself the same AD buff. (both ults have added components that aren't being compared.)

>Correct, except Janna's E performs at maximum at level 9, Taric's ult only performs optimally at level 16.

At rank 1 in a 5v5 team fight, Taric's gives 90 total AD (30 for him, 15 for 4 allies) VS Janna's 50 for 1 ally. So in terms of raw stats, Taric still wins when used *optimally* (see original post).

>Janna's E scales with AP, Taric's ult does not.

Consistency isn't always a bad thing - especially on a support. If his ult buff scaled, they would have to weaken it to compensate.

> Janna's E has 10 second cooldown with zero CDR which, even in optimal scenarios (Taric spamming to trigger passive) will still be quicker than Radiance (Obviously)
Janna's Shield once applied will remain as long as it holds, Taric needs to be near his targets.

We're arguing application now. Taric has to be in range, Janna's shield can't be popped. Neither scenario is perfect. What's more important is how the application functions with the champion's kit. 

>No. Taric himself gets 70 AD , the others get half.

So glad I didn't address this.
No wait, I did.
*"**If we ignore self cast**, taric beats her with 2 nearby champions (50 VS 70)."*

>Furthermore Janna's ult is Monsoon , not Eye of the Storm.

I...
...Um...
...Uh.
*{facepalm}*

>"Taric needs at least two nearby allied champions and again, that only works"
-------
Yes, at maximum level and only just barely.

Rank 1 Taric ult: 15 AD to each nearby champion. 60 if all 4 are nearby.
Rank 2: 25 AD. 50 if only 2 are nearby, 75 for 3.
Rank 3: 35 AD. 70 if only 2 nearby.
This is still ignoring his self buff.

So ignoring 4v4's, 5v5's, and self buffs, Janna gives away more Raw AD until max rank.
So you are technically correct here.

Love how you rewrote the quote, by the way.

>Meaningless, the benefit is spread across many champions and thus, is significantly less valuable than a concentrated benefit (Janna).

It's a situational question. Taric is balanced around being in a 5v5 team fight where his ult can have a huge impact, Janna is not.
That's exactly why I said, *"Radiance is actually pretty strong when used **optimally**."*

>Complete unadulterated BS.
That value is assuming every single character is in range and makes use of both AP/AD.

You're right. We're also assuming they are all in range.
Incidentally, we are assuming Janna's shield doesn't get instantly popped and is on someone who uses AD.

>Except Janna's has greater uptime, greater concentrated benefit and arguably greater range.

2390.8
Ok. Lets assume a 20 second teamfight (rather generous) and Janna has 45% CDR.
That give Janna's Shield a 5.5 second CD. 3 casts=16.5 seconds.
2390.8x3= *7172.4** gold value.
Just for fun, let us [again] give her 300 AP.
4001.5x3 = 12004.5
12004.5-11917.5=87
So with 300 AP (also generous) Janna's buff wins by *87* gold; meanwhile Taric doesn't have to build a thing (again, consistency isn't always bad).
The raw damage on Taric's ult has also been ignored in all of this.

The purpose of the gold conversion is to more clearly understand the raw value of what they offer. Which is, again, where I say Taric suffers from the aura problem. He has to be balanced around the assumption that it will be used optimally, which causes it to appear weaker than it actually is. For reference, see Sona's old auras and the the Aegis nerfs.

>Correct, except Taric's ult has limited range and significantly lower uptime... furthermore , it never overtakes Janna's direct AD benefit. And keep in mind we're comparing an ultimate to a NON ultimate spell... given the variables, the non ultimate spell is still coming out ahead.

Taric's aura has limited range, Janna's shield has to be intact. Janna's shield can be used more often, Taric's ult has a greater potential impact. They both have restrictions.

By, "direct AD benefit," I assume you are referring to what she gives to a *single* champion (ignoring self casts). In which case, you are correct. Taric isn't using his ult for the benefit of *one* person though. It's an *aura*; it is used by the *team*. You have to really finagle the scenario in Janna's favor for the *total* AD value to be greater (never mind the AP).

>Yes, lower CD.
And greater potential range.
And greater AD benefit.

**CD:** True. Flat out. Can't argue the CD is lower.
**Range:** Janna cast range 800, and they can walk away. Taric Aura range 1100. So Yes, I would agree Janna's shield has greater *potential* range.
**AD Benefit:** Already covered this one. Really dependent on how you phrase/interpret the claim, but Taric wins in most cases.

>If we ignore all of these, then yes, Radiance (the ultimate) is slightly better than Eye of the Storm (non ultimate).

While if we include them, Radiance (the ultimate) is *at worst* comparable to Eye of the Storm (non ultimate) when used sub-optimally.

>I do enjoy watching you desperately try to stack-the-deck in favor of Radiance... it's amusing.

Conversely, I enjoy watching you desperately try to stack-the-deck against Radiance... It's amusing.

------------------------

All of this is ultimately a moot point though (unless Riot keeps it as-is for some strange reason). Janna's shield is more interactive and interesting by simple virtue of being a shield. The [almost] sole purpose of Taric's ult is to be a bag of stats. So I'm all for it going away.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XveYVO93,comment-id=000400030000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-09T22:48:22.969+0000)
>
> You're comparing overall contribution to individual spikes. Even more, you're comparing kill lane supports to a buff support.

Taric is not a very good kill-lane support. Leona, Alistar, Blitz, Brand and several others are significantly better than Taric. You know this.... he is flimsy.

> Yes, morgana and Leona do more damage. That's kinda the point. They both have a large chunk of their power budget tied up in that damage

Except Leona also contributes to damage indirectly via her passive, I was talking about direct damage of which Leona still overtakes Taric by a significant amount.

Morgana as a support offers FAR more than just damage... her utility is one of the highest of any character in the game.

>where Taric places more stock in his utility.

I will grant you that Shatter Aura is unique and potentially very valuable, aside from that Taric's utility is garbage.

>Taric's ult gives him a specific window of power that the other two don't share; so it makes sense that his overall damage out-put would be less.

Except that "window of power" only gives him access to a mediocre set of benefits that are almost completely useless on him and only marginally useful on his ADC.

> The reason I compared Vayne is because the forums like to point out how she gets a huge AD buff from her ult. While Taric gives himself the same AD buff

Your comparison was nonsense.

By that logic, we could argue that Alistar's AD buff is stronger/weaker because, AD = AD.... the reason Vayne's AD is important is because it's focused on the person that needs it (ADC) and because of her multipliers (Q/Crit/ASPD/etc.).

> At rank 1 in a 5v5 team fight, Taric's gives 90 total AD

Ok, let me explain this again;
That's not how math works, you do not add the numbers spread across everyone into one neat package. He does not give "90 total AD" , he gives 30 to himself and 15 to each ally. If it gave 90 AD to a single character (Not him) it would be a fantastic ult.

> We're arguing application now. Taric has to be in range, Janna's shield can't be popped. Neither scenario is perfect. What's more important is how the application functions with the champion's kit. 

Sure, I will concede to that.

> Rank 1 Taric ult: 15 AD to each nearby champion. 60 if all 4 are nearby.
> Rank 2: 25 AD. 50 if only 2 are nearby, 75 for 3.
> Rank 3: 35 AD. 70 if only 2 nearby.
> This is still ignoring his self buff.

Taric's self buff is meaningless. His damage is a joke and one of the lowest of any support regardless of his ultimate. Even if his ult gave 200 AD/AP, Taric's damage would still be very low per game.

> It's a situational question. Taric is balanced around being in a 5v5 team fight where his ult can have a huge impact, Janna is not.

Except once again, you are assuming every character benefits from Taric's aura and is within range. That is the classic argument of theory vs. practice. You argue the potential, I will argue reality. You will lose every time.

> That value is assuming every single character is in range and makes use of both AP/AD.
> You're right. We're also assuming they are all in range [for all 10 seconds]

Which will never happen. That's nonsense.

> Incidentally, we are assuming Janna's shield doesn't get instantly popped and is on someone who uses AD.

The nice part about that is; The ADC will generally be in the back and not the primary , or often even secondary, focus .... and if the ADC gets targeted, Janna conveniently has (arguably) the best peel in the game.

> Ok. Lets assume a 20 second teamfight (rather generous) and Janna has 45% CDR.
> That give Janna's Shield a 5.5 second CD. 3 casts=16.5 seconds.

That assumes Janna will not have a shield cast on someone as the fight begins.... but sure, let's use your skewed numbers.

> 2390.8x3= *7172.4** gold value.
> Just for fun, let us [again] give her 300 AP.
> 4001.5x3 = 12004.5
> 12004.5-11917.5=87
> So with 300 AP (also generous) Janna's buff wins by *87* gold; meanwhile Taric doesn't have to build a thing (again, consistency isn't always bad).

The difference being, you are comparing an ULTIMATE vs. a NON ULTIMATE and even giving extremely generous benefits to Radiance, it still loses.

> The raw damage on Taric's ult has also been ignored in all of this.

The pop radius has atrocious range.... getting that close will also tend to place him away from his ADC, which is a bad thing.


>He has to be balanced around the assumption that it will be used optimally

Even under optimal circumstances, the benefit is so flimsy and insignificant so as to not even exist.

> Taric's aura has limited range, Janna's shield has to be intact. Janna's shield can be used more often, Taric's ult has a greater potential impact. They both have restrictions.

Incorrect. 

Janna's shield gives greater benefit to the target that needs it the most therefore Janna's shield comes out ahead in both quick skirmishes and extended teamfights.

> By, "direct AD benefit," I assume you are referring to what she gives to a single champion (ignoring self casts). In which case, you are correct. Taric isn't using his ult for the benefit of one person though. It's an aura; it is used by the team. You have to really finagle the scenario in Janna's favor for the total AD value to be greater (never mind the AP).

Except , yet again, Janna is giving the damage benefit (AD) to the person that will make the best use of it (ADC  or AD scaling champ like Talon/Zed) whereas Taric is wasting a large chunk of his aura on characters that will not benefit from his aura in any meaningful way.

> **CD:** True. Flat out. Can't argue the CD is lower.

Trying to argue CD  against Eye of the Storm would be tantamount to admitting that you are arguing for the sake of arguing, so let's proceed.

> **Range:** Janna cast range 800, and they can walk away. Taric Aura range 1100. So Yes, I would agree Janna's shield has greater *potential* range.

Fair enough.

> **AD Benefit:** Already covered this one. Really dependent on how you phrase/interpret the claim, but Taric wins in most cases.

Wrong. I have explained multiple times already.

> While if we include them, Radiance (the ultimate) is *at worst* comparable to Eye of the Storm (non ultimate) when used sub-optimally.

Except because Eye of the Storm is targeted, it will overwhelmingly be used on the correct target, under optimal scenario.... whereas Radiance is highly dependent and even stacking the numbers heavily, it still flounders against a non ultimate skill.

Basically, to finish this;
There's a reason we're not seeing a swath of Taric players in LCS or Worlds. 
And no, it has nothing to do with how he "Feels", it has to do with  him being putrid scoriae.
Note however, that Janna has seen high level play over multiple seasons' tournaments.
Do you understand?

> Conversely, I enjoy watching you desperately try to stack-the-deck against Radiance... It's amusing.

The difference is;
I don't need to stack-the-deck against Radiance, it's already garbage.... by virtue of Eye of the Storm being used on the person that will most benefit from it, it is by definition already "stacking-the-deck" (Putting AD on top of AD) whereas Radiance is just sploched at random, unfocused garbage.

> All of this is ultimately a moot point though

Yes it is.

I am glad Riot is seeing reality and will undoubtedly buff the piece of garbage that is Radiance. 
Good riddance.

>Taric is not a very good kill-lane support. Leona, Alistar, Blitz, Brand and several others are significantly better than Taric. You know this.... he is flimsy.

Taric isn't a kill lane support. I agree. He's a buff support.
That was my point.
Saying he's a weaker support because he doesn't do as much damage as someone who is supposed to be outputting good damage is a tad silly.

>Except Leona also contributes to damage indirectly via her passive, I was talking about direct damage of which Leona still overtakes Taric by a significant amount.

Leona is *supposed* to do damage. She's exactly what I'm referring to by having power budget invested into that damage. She's borderline bruiser. Some even use her that way!

>Morgana as a support offers FAR more than just damage... her utility is one of the highest of any character in the game.

Morgana is a utility mage and functions as a kill lane support. She bring black shield, a root, and a delayed stun. Her damage is horribly unreliable unless you land the root first. But her play metric is to do a *lot* of damage to anyone she can properly combo.

Compare to Taric who brings bonus armor aura, armor shred, heal, stun, bonus AD&AP. A lot more of his power budget is invested in that utility which is why he can't output the same level of damage as others.

>Except that "window of power" only gives him access to a mediocre set of benefits that are almost completely useless on him and only marginally useful on his ADC.

70 AD and AP with a rank 3 ult.

+21 health on ally heal, 29.4 on self heal.
+14-28 damage on dazzle.
+70 AD [self explanatory]

Taric has 117 AD at level 18. With ult he has 187.
For comparison:
Mordekaiser has 146 (highest base).
Zed (counting bonus) has 141.25.

Despite being a buff support, Taric is *still* a tank. He wants to be on the front line whaling on people. 70 bonus AD isn't "useless".
His Aura is marginally useful on *everyone*, not just useful for the ADC. Again, his ult isn't meant to benefit one person; that's why the individual numbers are low.

>Your comparison was nonsense.

>By that logic, we could argue that Alistar's AD buff is stronger/weaker because, AD = AD.... the reason Vayne's AD is important is because it's focused on the person that needs it (ADC) and because of her multipliers (Q/Crit/ASPD/etc.).

It really depends on how you play Alistar. But saying the bonuses are useless because the beneficiary does things other than AA is equally nonsense.
Taric uses AA's [and shatter] as his primary source of damage. Alistar's ult gives him a damage option outside his CC combo.
I'll concede they use it less effectively than an ADC, but they still *use it*. 

>Ok, let me explain this again;
That's not how math works, you do not add the numbers spread across everyone into one neat package. He does not give "90 total AD" , he gives 30 to himself and 15 to each ally. If it gave 90 AD to a single character (Not him) it would be a fantastic ult.

Ok... My understanding is 30+15+15+15+15 = 90. If that's not how math works, then science may have a problem. (>_>)

If 90 damage is done by 1 person or spread out over 5, what difference does it make? 90 damage is still done. That's the core principle around which auras are balanced.
Is it always going to work that way? no. But if we assume only 1 or 2 people use it, then it becomes OP with all 5. Taric's Ult is really strong when used optimally (I've been saying this from the start).

I understand where you're coming from. You would rather have less total output that you are certain will be fully utilized. I agree! But that doesn't make the other approach weaker.

>Taric's self buff is meaningless. His damage is a joke and one of the lowest of any support regardless of his ultimate. Even if his ult gave 200 AD/AP, Taric's damage would still be very low per game.

There's more to a support than damage. Taric invests a lot of budget into his buffs; damage falls off as a consequence. That doesn't mean he won't AA. The self buff gives him respectable damage (for a support) during fights. But he's not going to output damage equal to champions designed for it for most of the game. If you're looking to do damage as support, you really shouldn't be using Taric.

>Except once again, you are assuming every character benefits from Taric's aura and is within range. That is the classic argument of theory vs. practice. You argue the potential, I will argue reality. You will lose every time.

I'm going to say this again.
"Radiance is actually pretty strong when used optimally."
Also, what characters *don't* benefit from his Aura? Off the top of my head, I can't think of any champion that doesn't use AD *or* AP. There's a handful that only use one. Some champions benefit *more* from his aura than other, definitely.
Also, his Aura radius is 1100. The longest AA range is is Cait's headshot at 1300, followed by Twitch's ult at 850. The aura puts him at the edge of Xerath's threat range. So.... who is sitting out of range here? Jhin?

>The nice part about that is; The ADC will generally be in the back and not the primary , or often even secondary, focus .... and if the ADC gets targeted, Janna conveniently has (arguably) the best peel in the game.

You're right. She does. But now we're comparing kits. I'm already making the basic assumption that *both* abilities are utilized optimally. That has been my entire basis from the start.

Also, who is your team targeting; The tank? Or are we assuming both teams are using siege comps with Illaoi and Taric playing checkers in the middle?

>That assumes Janna will not have a shield cast on someone as the fight begins.... but sure, let's use your skewed numbers.

It's assuming she casts the shield the moment the fight begins. I'm skewing this in her favor already and you want to nit-pick the scenario even more?

>The difference being, you are comparing an ULTIMATE vs. a NON ULTIMATE and even giving extremely generous benefits to Radiance, it still loses.

Um..... and I'm not giving extremely generous benefits to Eye of the storm?
3 casts.
300 AP.
And it comes out ahead by 87 gold.

I'm sorry. How much AP does Janna normally end with?

>The pop radius has atrocious range.... getting that close will also tend to place him away from his ADC, which is a bad thing.

I agree the pop radius is sad. If he's fighting and the ADC isn't his Aura range though, he probably shouldn't be fighting.

>Even under optimal circumstances, the benefit is so flimsy and insignificant so as to not even exist.

The whole point is to give a smaller individual benefit to a larger group, rather than a smaller total benefit to an individual. You're trading consistent output for peak potential.
As a principle, neither approach is weaker. It's just a question of which you would prefer. As stated above, I also prefer consistency; but that doesn't make consistency better.

>Incorrect.

>Janna's shield gives greater benefit to the target that needs it the most therefore Janna's shield comes out ahead in both quick skirmishes and extended teamfights.

Taric gives a bigger benefit to the *team*. Janna gives a bigger benefit to an *individual*. If you're doing quick skirmishes, Janna comes ahead because of the low CD. In a full on team fight, Taric provides more raw stats.

>Except , yet again, Janna is giving the damage benefit (AD) to the person that will make the best use of it (ADC or AD scaling champ like Talon/Zed) whereas Taric is wasting a large chunk of his aura on characters that will not benefit from his aura in any meaningful way.

Hmm..... Again. What champion doesn't use AD or AP? If they benefit from the buff in a fight, the buff is meaningful.
Do you instead mean in an "overtly significant" way? Of course, Riven isn't going to use the AP, but the AD is still valuable. Or perhaps you want the power shifted into a single stat. Say, each ally gets 50 AD, but no AP. Of course, that means the aura is wasted on Karthus would would rather have the AP.
Just because champion A gets more use out of a buff than champion B, that doesn't mean champion B wasn't effectively buffed *unless* they genuinely can't use the buff.

>Except because Eye of the Storm is targeted, it will overwhelmingly be used on the correct target, under optimal scenario.... whereas Radiance is highly dependent and even stacking the numbers heavily, it still flounders against a non ultimate skill.

Radiance is a *team* oriented skill. It excels in the presence of a *team*. It's not floundering, it's restricted. Janna's shield isn't team oriented, it benefits a single person. Eye of the storm will only ever effect 1 person and is balanced as such. Radiance has to be balanced around the potential of affecting 5 people, and therefore can't be balanced assuming only 1 beneficiary.

>Basically, to finish this;
There's a reason we're not seeing a swath of Taric players in LCS or Worlds.
And no, it has nothing to do with how he "Feels", it has to do with him being putrid scoriae.
Note however, that Janna has seen high level play over multiple seasons' tournaments.
Do you understand?

"Feels"? (o_O)

AS for high level and organized play. Ultimately, Taric's niche is being a ball of stats for the team. That niche isn't particularly valuable in an organized environment.
